main event: A civilian airline pilot observed a bright light in the sky near Tulsa, Oklahoma, on October 23, 1954.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 1 minute during the initial observation, with a later observation lasting about half a minute., The object was reported to be stationary, indicating an unusual characteristic., The pilot described the object as the size of a small fighter with half-moon shaped wings., No noise, smoke, or vapor was detected from the object., Five civilian witnesses were also in the area at the time of the sighting, but their observations were not detailed.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
witness description: airline pilot and five civilian witnesses
